solution_line_template: Sadie ran for {sadie_speed} miles/hour * {sadie_time} hour = <<{sadie_speed}*{sadie_time}={sadie_distance}>>{sadie_distance} miles.
Ariana covered a distance of {ariana_speed} miles/hour * ({ariana_time_fraction}) hour = {ariana_distance} miles.
Sarah ran for {total_race_time} hours - {sadie_time} hours - {ariana_time_decimal} hours = <<{total_race_time}-{sadie_time}-{ariana_time_decimal}={sarah_time}>>{sarah_time} hours.
In this time, Sarah traveled a distance of {sarah_speed} miles/hour * {sarah_time} hours = <<{sarah_speed}*{sarah_time}={sarah_distance}>>{sarah_distance} miles.

The total distance for the race was {sadie_distance} miles + {ariana_distance} miles + {sarah_distance} miles = <<{sadie_distance}+{ariana_distance}+{sarah_distance}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} miles.
